p.k: A look at the life and music of Janis Joplin. Known for her powerful, blues-inspired vocals, she rose to fame in the late 1960s before dying of a drug overdose in 1970
In Melbourne, Aled Jones uncovers the eccentric world of Percy Grainger, whose work was often experimental and unusual
Series exploring the vibrant musical journeys of history's great composers, including Beethoven, Mozart, Haydn and Schubert, who, at one time or another
The Landlady When a young man arrives in Bath, he is shocked to find his seemingly charming landlady has a dark side
Neck A young lady is cut down to size by her husband's loyal butler when it is discovered she is having an affair
Edward the Conqueror When Edward grows tired of his wife Louisa's obsession with a stray cat and decides to get rid of it, Louisa exacts her revenge
A Dip in the Pool An American gambler must come up with a cunning plan to slow down a ship at sea in order to win a bet
The Way Up To Heaven Mrs Foster exacts an intriguing revenge on her husband after his dawdling causes her to miss a flight

n.u: Frank Auerbach: The South Bank Show Originals

p.n: Frank Auerbach: The South Bank Show Originals VI (1)
p.k: New. A look back at Melvyn Bragg's insightful interview with the celebrated German-British artist in a classic episode of The South Bank Show
Leading film critics discuss the life and career of Bing Crosby, who became an Oscar-winning movie star and best-selling singer despite a number of personal troubles
A look at the career of Vivien Leigh, who scooped an Oscar as Scarlett O'Hara, famously married star Laurence Olivier and died of tuberculosis aged 53
The story of the actor renowned for his roles in gangster films The Public Enemy and White Heat, whose battles with the Hollywood studios changed
An intimate look at the life and career of John Wayne. Born Marion Morrison, the former football player would become one of the most iconic actors of the 20th century
Leading film critics discuss the career of Charlton Heston. After humble beginnings on stage, he took Hollywood by storm with starring in Ben-Hur and Planet of the Apes

p.n: Passions: Bernstein By Dame Kiri Te Kanawa
p.k: New. Opera star Dame Kiri Te Kanawa explores the genius of Leonard Bernstein, with whom she worked on the landmark 1984 recording of West Side Story
New. A look at how Thomas Heatherwick's unusual and stunning design of many staircases became a mind-blowing tourist attraction in Manhattan, known as the Vessel

p.n: Elvis Presley: A Legend in Concert
p.k: Sensational collection of TV performances from The King. Featuring the notorious screen debut of his famous pelvic gyrations and the time Steve Allen
Documentary chronicling the extraordinary five-day train ride and series of concerts across Canada in 1970 that featured Janis Joplin, The Grateful Dead

p.n: Come Together: The Rise Of The Festival
p.k: Documentary examining the evolution of the music festival, from Newport, Monterey Pop, Woodstock and the Isle of Wight in the 60s to modern events such as Glastonbury

p.n: Joe Cocker: Mad Dog With Soul
p.k: Documentary charting the rise of Joe Cocker, a gas fitter who played in Sheffield pubs and was catapulted to stardom following a spectacular appearance
New. Exclusive interviews and astonishing footage tell the epic story of the 1969 Woodstock festival. In a time of civil unrest, half a million people

p.n: Santana: Greatest Hits Live at Montreux
p.k: Carlos Santana and his band plays their greatest hits, including Black Magic Woman and Oye Coma Va, at the 2011 Montreux Jazz Festival in Switzerland
Friends and fans of Jimi Hendrix tell the story of one of rock's great icons, who dazzled crowds in the 60s with his outrageous electric guitar playing
A look at the rise of rock opera pioneers The Who, from their formation at school in Acton, London, to their award-winning albums and sell out tours around the world
